p: Each human and animal population consists of a susceptible S, exposed E, infective I and removed R (= recovered/immune) compartment. There is a flow back from the removed to the susceptible compartment in both populations, i.e. immunity is not lifelong. All individuals are born susceptible and a proportion of the pregnant infected animals abort. Vectors A and B allow for vertical transmission: infected females ( I compartment) transmit infection to their eggs ( Q compartment), where the virus survives until the larv√¶ hatch and the resulting adults are infective. Vector A furthermore has the possibility of long-term dormancy in the egg stage (both infected and non-infected).
